The recent shifting paradigm toward a high level of wintering activity of plankton populations (
53 ) also suggests that we should revisit our way of considering the winter Arctic marine ecosystem. The projected increase and advanced sea-ice GPP found in our simulations ( Fig. 3) may also be an earlier potential pulse of energy for the active winter plankton communities in the low latitudes of the Arctic, although the large reduction in first-year ice extent would likely limit this effect.
